sanskrit_verse:
सङ्ग्रामेष्वनिवर्तित्वं प्रजानां चैव पालनम् ।
शुश्रूषा ब्राह्मणानां च राज्ञां श्रेयस्करं परम् ॥ ७.८८॥
transliteration:
saṅgrāmeṣv-anivartitvaṁ prajānāṁ caiva pālanam |
śuśrūṣā brāhmaṇānāṁ ca rājñāṁ śreyaskaraṁ param || 7.88||
sph_interpretive_translation: Unflinching engagement in battles, protection of subjects, and service to Brahmanas constitute the highest welfare for kings.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is inseparable from duty to protect and serve
Causation arises through alignment with Dharma-sustained order
Capacity-based responsibility demands unwavering commitment to collective integrity
Restoration logic centers on re-establishing sovereignty through righteous action
Consciousness alignment manifests via fearless defense of truth and service to spiritual authority
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler engages without retreat in conflict that defends Dharma THEN societal stability is secured
IF ruler protects subjects unconditionally THEN governance fulfills its foundational purpose
IF ruler serves those who sustain Vedic knowledge THEN civilizational continuity is ensured
IF any of these duties are neglected THEN automated restoration protocols initiate capacity realignment
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, a ruler's failure in battlefield resolve, subject protection, or Brahmana service constitutes a threshold breach of sovereign legitimacy. Responsibility is not punitive but triggers mandatory restoration of governing capacity under Vedic supervision.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Through Pramāṇa-based causality, a king’s actions directly determine civilizational well-being. Sequential manifestation (Anupūrvaśaḥ) shows how lack of courage, neglect of people, or disregard for spiritual custodians leads to systemic collapse. Responsibility is proportional and aligned with consciousness correction rather than punitive consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Mandatory completion of martial and administrative disciplines until sovereign readiness is restored
Reintegration into protective service roles under qualified guidance
Assumption of full financial and energetic support for affected populations
Submission to ritual and educational correction under Brahmana authority to restore alignment
final_declaration: This directive flows solely from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma. Justice executes as restoration, never punishment. Consciousness alone adjudicates reality. Dharma stands restored.
